author: {'steamid': '76561198186530370', 'num_games_owned': 2632, 'num_reviews': 571, 'playtime_forever': 1037, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1037, 'last_played': 1692801432}
review:
Bit.Trip VOID is a short game that is reasonably challenging and fun for what is it. 

Although, that being said, it feels more like a free casual browser game that someone will play to kill time during a dull day at the computer rather than something to invest your time and money into. 

Caveat Emptor I guess, it depends what you are into as a gamer whether you prefer short arcade style games or epic adventures. If you are the former then you'll probably get a kick out of this game, however, I will say: beware of the 7.99 price-tag vs the amount of content this game has to offer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043782587', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 598, 'playtime_forever': 92, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 92, 'last_played': 1623674438}
review:
Third game in the series.

This time you are a sphere that can move around screen. You grow as you consume black dots. Black dots must not be missed. But you also have to avoid white dots, so you have a button to reset your size back to default. White dots also do that, but you get punished anyway. Pretty original idea.

But well, not satisfying, sorry. Three long levels. At least they brought in checkpoint. I thought that they will be able to make me feel good playing this game with music like they seemingly started to learn with CORE but eh, I just didn't care here.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023152183', 'num_games_owned': 894, 'num_reviews': 141, 'playtime_forever': 241, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 241, 'last_played': 1599362703}
review:
As far as Bit.Trip games go, this one is quite entertaining as one would expect though more abstract and probably shorter than its counterparts.

It continues their trend of having a new ryhthm-based gameplay mechanic. Sadly, the way in how it is presented may seem confusing at first and probably won't come back in the near future. What's more, as with other games in the saga, in some instances the replayabilty is almost mandatory in order to remember how to get through them.

Nonetheless, it stands out from the rest with its presentation, particularly its modes and how it displays its score. More so, due to some quite old events at the time of writing this review, it is also the easiest game to complete achievement-wise, which is not to say its difficulty is much lower in comparison.
All in all, considering its price I'd say it's worth a try at the very least.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043728918', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 291, 'playtime_forever': 59, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1588732099}
review:
I can appreciate the way the BIT.TRIP games try to change things up and make small games out of novel ideas. They're basically lengthened mini-games with steep learning curves and high difficulty. 

My problem with the games has always been that at their worst (Runner, Core), they are memorization affairs where the challenge lies in trial and error. Otherwise the games typically have ideas that are unique, but clunky in their execution or with some drawbacks (Fate). Void falls somewhere in the latter.

Void is a very simple game: you are a circle that can move all over the screen, and have to dodge incoming white dots whilst collecting black dots. The white dots and black dots tend to come in as pairs or in patterns. Collecting black dots increases your size, but also increases your score. You can always 'release' the black dots and fall back to a smaller circle, which allows you to move and dodge better. After all, a huge black circle on the screen can't dodge all the incoming white dots if it can't even move. 

It's clearly a score-attack based game. I can appreciate the unique concept, and unlike the other games this one relies less on memorizing patterns and more on an enjoyable balance of just reacting and moving whilst managing a want for a higher score with the need to dodge. I can appreciate the balancing act.

I actually like it a little more than the other BIT.TRIP games because of that, but the easier game is also lacking in substance. Its an example in something that is interesting on paper but turns out to be nothing more than busy-work in-game. It's just not enjoyable or enticing enough to even finish. Ironically some sort of drawback or ability when coming back down in size would've provided some interesting pull and push with the game mechanics. 

The actual challenge and possibilities in how large you can get are finite, due to the incoming white dots and the impossibility of dodging them past a certain size. So the highest score possible has a ceiling anyway. It's not infinite possibility. 

Not bad, but also not enjoyable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198172925593', 'num_games_owned': 13974, 'num_reviews': 4529, 'playtime_forever': 154, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 154, 'last_played': 1578824001}
review:
系列之一的反应力游戏
基本规则很简单：吃黑色、躲白色，本体变大后按空格释放（好像有分数加成）
撑到关底根据吃掉的黑球与白球数量增减分数，如果碰到过多的白色物体也是会中途失败的
总体来说可以稍微玩一下，但价格还是有些贵的

author: {'steamid': '76561198027973295', 'num_games_owned': 1825, 'num_reviews': 1844, 'playtime_forever': 96, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 96, 'last_played': 1654863180}
review:
Третья часть серии Bit.Trip, где вы управляете черной точкой. Поедание черных точек приводит к росту персонажа, белые все портят. Задача игрока ловить черные точки и не забывать ужимать в размерах своего героя, иначе уклоняться от белых в какой-то момент станет невозможно.

Для меня первая часть серии, где положительные эмоции перевешивают отрицательные. Попробовать стоит.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995424564', 'num_games_owned': 240, 'num_reviews': 137, 'playtime_forever': 93, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 91, 'last_played': 1679580054}
review:
La série des "Bit. Trip" est une série de six jeux pionniers du néo-rétro, de vrais bijoux de game design offrant un scoring intelligent et stimulant, des contrôles novateurs, une immersion dans un univers nostalgique et décalé, une fantastique harmonie entre gameplay et musique, et de longues heures d'amusement.

Originellement, la série a été développée pour WiiWare, le service de jeux dématérialisés de la Wii, le seul où elle pouvait trouver un créneau commercial en 2009. Ensuite, elle a été portée sur cartouche dans une compilation Nintendo 3DS, puis épisode par épisode sur Steam, pour enfin ressortir sur Wii au format DVD dans la compilation "Bit. Trip Complete". Parmi toutes ces options, la meilleure façon d'y jouer aujourd'hui est de lancer "Bit. Trip Complete" sur console Wii U ou sur Dolphin, l'émulateur Wii et GameCube, malgré la HD et la connectivité de Steam.

Il y a une explication simple à cela: Gaijin Games a beaucoup de talent mais a codé ses jeux "salement", en "moulant" son code dans les moindres spécificités de la Wii. Quand la décision de porter les jeux sur d'autres systèmes a été prise, le studio n'a pas tout recodé "au propre", confiant au lieu de cela son code et l'opération de portage à un autre studio, qui n'avait ni les moyens ni le temps de le faire comme cela aurait dû être fait.

Résultat: le code a été laissé tel quel, et pour corriger ses inadéquations variées aux nouveaux systèmes, une couche de code supplémentaire a été bricolée par-dessus. Très inefficient, ce procédé a eu de lourdes conséquences sur la version 3DS des jeux, mais aussi sur les portages Steam: fluidité approximative, saccades, désynchronisations, bugs - malgré la simplicité des jeux et la puissance des PC, l'expérience est très imparfaite à comparer des originaux.

Je possède toute la série sur Steam, et je dirais que [i]Runner,[/i] [i]Void[/i] et [i]Fate[/i] sont dans un état acceptable, [i]Runner[/i] étant le jeu le plus marquant des trois, un des meilleurs automatic runners jamais sortis, à mon avis bien meilleur que sa suite "Runner 2". Dans le cas de [i]Beat,[/i] je trouve qu'aucun moyen de contrôle ne remplace idéalement la rotation de la Wiimote, et [i]Core[/i] a une difficulté mal réglée alors que [i]Flux[/i] est littéralement injouable. Si j'admire la série sur Wii, je n'en recommanderais donc ici que trois jeux à petit prix, ce qui est tragique puisque Steam est le moyen le plus pratique de les acheter aujourd'hui. Si vous êtes perfectionniste, privilégiez l'émulation sur Dolphin, d'autant plus que les jeux restent chers sur Steam vu leur état, alors que "Bit. Trip Complete" propose des défis supplémentaires très bien conçus et des bonus à débloquer (images de prototypes, vidéos, etc.).

([url=https://simbabbad.blogspot.com/2015/01/la-serie-des-bit-trip-wii-3ds-steam.html]critique complète de la saga sur mon blog[/url])

author: {'steamid': '76561198027267313', 'num_games_owned': 1838, 'num_reviews': 4460, 'playtime_forever': 71, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71, 'last_played': 1643037422}
review:
Tags: Shootemup & Bullet Hell
Additional Tags: Delete Local Content & Remove from Library

TLDR: Bullet Hell game without shooting. Dodge the white bullets while eating the black ones. Manage your hitbox by shrinking your ship on the regular. Bland and chaotic and unsatisfying

Operating the shrinking mechanic just removes your current sprite and spawns the small one, while in movement especially it can be very unintuitive to guess where you will spawn and since you often have tight margins you will be in an impossible situation where you can either hit a while bullet and shrink, then on shrink be disoriented and eat another white bullet, or attempt to dodge a bulletrain, shrink on purpose in motion and still eat a white bullet due to disorientation.

There are little scripted moments where you are obviously meant to shrink on regular intervals due to strict limitations and the bullets that are eaten do produce a blip sound but I would hardly consider the thing to be musical.

The trippy effects of getting higher schores and being bumped to a higher mode have been toned down in comparison to other games leaving that feature feeling underdevelopped and pointless as well and it merely acts as a health buffer between getting hit and the game over.

Conclusion: Not much that I enjoyed here, additionally I had one crash to desktop while first loading and after entering scores the game prompts you to press A but the correct key to press is START on the xbox360 pad. The kind of little details that further give a low effort impression on the title as a whole. Removed local content permanently and hiding from library due to saturation of high quality bullet hell games already in collection.

author: {'steamid': '76561198130932508', 'num_games_owned': 1226, 'num_reviews': 724, 'playtime_forever': 70, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 70, 'last_played': 1419248142}
review:
[h1]Черная дыра[/h1]

Еще одна игра из серии БитТрип, в которой нужно ловить черные квадраты черной дырой, при этом пропуская белые. Игра на реакцию, и по началу всё идет хорошо, однако позже игра предоставит игроку настоящий челендж. А еще картинка и саундтрек - они ничего так.

Рекомендую, одна из самых простых игр из всей серии БитТрип, имхо.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083709099', 'num_games_owned': 574, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1208, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1204, 'last_played': 1590534571}
review:
Another great entry in the BIT.TRIP series. Unlike BEAT and CORE, where you had to hit all beats, you must collect the black beats with your "Void" while avoiding the white beats.  Your Void grows as you collect beats, and you have to decide for yourself when to bank those collected- in case you hit a white beat and lose everything.

Unlike CORE, I recognized specific retro games that the game was paying homage to: Level 2 references [spoiler] Pac-Man	[/spoiler], while Level 3 references [spoiler] Space Invaders	[/spoiler] and [spoiler] The World's Hardest Game	[/spoiler] (if you can call that retro).

The game is challenging, yet not as much as CORE- I managed to complete VOID in fewer than 18 months!

The visuals and music in the game are more sparse and less memorable than previous games. However, it seems suitable for a game with "Void" in the title. The tunes are still great, and there are some memorable images; my favourite is a segment where the white beats dance like a church organ.

A game well worth playing. 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198022227319', 'num_games_owned': 4498, 'num_reviews': 221, 'playtime_forever': 70, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 70, 'last_played': 1489738658}
review:
TL;DR Below.

I love the BIT.TRIP series but for many reasons this title failed to satsify my rhythmic needs. The music compared to the runner series, Beat series, and Core, seems to be all beat/bass and no melody (In my opinion). There is no exact or specific time you're required to collect dots which kind of defeats the purpose of a rhythm game. The game is by no means horrible, but it does not fit into the category of rhythm games. 

There is also no indication or anything that notifies the player that they're near the next phase, near nether, or shows them their total score... why may I ask? The BIT.TRIP Runner series had it, so did the Beat series, why not Void?

As for controls, BIT.TRIP Void is the one title in the series where you are not required to tap a certain key to the beat of the music. Instead, you are required to MOVE in order to collect the beat, regardless of whether it is to the music. This makes the whole concept of "rhythm" obsolete, as you are not required to collect a dot in time to the beat of the music. (There is no consistency). The game doesn't allow you to choose how you control your orb. It's fixed on keys. Being a rhythm game, precision is a vital component. There are times in the game where getting a dot requires you to be pinpoint accurate. Not being able to fluently move is a big no-no for rhythm games where you are able to move freely. Even just a tap of a key can cause you to overshoot ending your combo and possibly even sending you into the nether... how would you know? There's no health bar! 
Being able to use the mouse would've definitely turned the tables around, although it wouldn't help with the musical aspect of the game. 

Long story short, BIT.TRIP Void isn't a horrible game, but for a rhythmic game, it does a horrible job trying to accomplish what it set out to achieve. It is tagged as "Rhythmic" but I would not call it that at all, but rather survival. I find myself focusing more on surviving than enjoying the music as I cannot or can barely hear it. Since the game doesn't require you to pick up dots on a constant beat, you can just run around picking up black orbs that are in safe reach regardless of listening to the actual music. I would not call this rhythmic as there is no rhythm you're creating. As opposed to the other series, where you HAVE to be rhythmic in order to successful pass the levels.

TL;DR: Interesting game, but bad controls and no engaging rhythmic music that actually requires you to be rhythmic. 

In my honest opinion, just get the other titles, they are way better and are actually rhythmic.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969189043', 'num_games_owned': 5887, 'num_reviews': 147, 'playtime_forever': 62, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 62, 'last_played': 1485736252}

author: {'steamid': '76561198033169303', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1388163166}
review:
Didn't enjoy it.
No clue what the hell this game even is.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032531136', 'num_games_owned': 581, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 451, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 417, 'last_played': 1667822937}
review:
Note : 4,5/5
Comme toujours chez Gaijin Games, le but du jeu et les mécaniques pour y parvenir sont d’une compréhension enfantine mais ils vont demander de la part du joueur une coordination et un sens du rythme réglés au millimètre. 
Mais tout d’abord, présentons Bit. Trip void : vous incarnez une boule noire et vous devez manger d’autres boules noires qui apparaissent sur l’écran, pour grossir et marquer de plus en plus de points. Bien entendu, les choses ne seraient pas aussi faciles sans la présence de boules blanches que vous devez absolument éviter, sous peine de diminuer drastiquement de taille, voire même d’approcher du fatidique Game Over. 
Les graphismes font preuve d’un sens du minimalisme aigu. Et heureusement car l’attention requise pourrait en être détournée.  Les sons jouent un rôle important car ils donnent une mélodie qui autorisent presque au joueur de s’amuser les yeux fermés, à force de recommencer. Car oui, vous allez recommencer, ayant cette sensation persistante que l’obstacle qui vous a fait perdre, vous allez le surmonter cette fois-ci !
Bit. Trip void est un jeu prenant, dont la durée de vie dépendra de votre dextérité, de votre calme, et de votre patience. Il plaira assurément aux amateurs de challenge, basé sur la mémoire et les réflexes. Les autres risquent d’être rebutés par sa difficulté et son aridité graphique.

author: {'steamid': '76561198173380001', 'num_games_owned': 380, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 201, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 97, 'last_played': 1540263901}

author: {'steamid': '76561198030405593', 'num_games_owned': 356, 'num_reviews': 99, 'playtime_forever': 165, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 72, 'last_played': 1470071594}

author: {'steamid': '76561198028333265', 'num_games_owned': 1058, 'num_reviews': 411, 'playtime_forever': 287, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 167, 'last_played': 1484752972}
review: Хоть эта игра и раздражает огромной сложностью как и прошлые игры, да, тут чем ты больше тем сложнее уворчаиваться от пикселей. Игру сделали непроходимой. Вроде кажется как не старайся, нельзя оставаться огромным всю игру, но ругать игру тоже не получается. Опять таки тут всё основано на саундтреке и приятней просто слушать эту музыку и просто ловить чёрные кубики. Тут всё равно проиграть довольно трудно. Нисколько не жалею что купил, только лучше дождаться распродаж.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028835124', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 251, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 228, 'last_played': 1452991447}

author: {'steamid': '76561198028635556', 'num_games_owned': 1079, 'num_reviews': 143, 'playtime_forever': 130, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 129, 'last_played': 1448329732}
review:
As I have been playing through the Bit.Trip games I have really been underwhelmed by what I have "played". This game was by far the most underwhelming.

In the other Bit.Trip games that I have played they have usually been bad ports, bad controlling, and bad looking games but each Bit Trip game just seems to be bad in one respect while being tolerable in others. If the studio that produced these games and that overlooked the production of these games had just taken the all the good portions of each game they could have made a really great game.

Now that I think about it, they already have.

If you are intrigued by the Bit.Trip "franchise" I would recommend just getting Bit.Trip Beat, and the Bit.Trip Runner games. The other games aren't worth your time. Bit.Trip FLUX is another good game, but make sure you don't buy it on PC.

author: {'steamid': '76561198142279336', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 51, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 51, 'last_played': 1425201476}
review: Управлять вам дадут черной точкой (черной дырой). Задача, стоящая перед вами, очень проста - собирать черные точки и пропускать белые. Главное не лажать. По началу все довольно просто и ваша реакция успевает за игрой. Однако рано или поздно вам придется отправиться в черно-белый мир, дабы испытать свои шансы на победу. Проиграете в нем - потерпите полное фиаско. Меня очень порадовали схватки с местными боссами. Они даже лучше, чем в остальных биттрипах. Обязательно стоит остановиться на отличном 8-ми битном саундтреке. Геймплей заточен под него или наоборот). Приятно видить, что даже музыка реагирует на ваши прямые действия. Визуальный стиль узнаваем, именно тот, что и в остальных играх франчайза.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991130847', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 100, 'playtime_forever': 68, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 19, 'playtime_at_review': 49, 'last_played': 1711127582}
review:
Dans la jolie série des Bit Trip, Void est peut-être l'un des plus minimalistes.

Dans cet opus, vous dirigez un amas de pixels noirs pouvant librement se balader dans un monde tout en 2D, votre but ici étant d'amasser tous les pixels noirs que vous croiserez afin de grossir encore et encore. Mais attention, car grossir réduit votre vitesse et la visibilité à l'écran ! Ce serait évidement trop facile, si des nuées de pixels blancs ne se baladaient pas non plus. Un seul contact et pouf, vous éclatez :p. Le but du jeu est en fait d'être le plus gros possible pour marquer des points, sachant que vous pouvez réduire votre taille pour éviter les collisions.

Outre la difficulté augmentant rapidement, c'est le côté musicale qui est mis à l'honneur. Chaque collecte de pixel noir produit un son, ce qui peut au final former des mélodies assez psychédéliques.

Bref, Void se détache des autres (pouvant d'ailleurs se jouer à quatre), de par son graphisme et son épuration, un peu trop poussée à mon gout.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038477497', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 7, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1420257667}

而且这游戏必定无法进行下去，因为最后你还是会撑满屏幕，玩家会在没有任何的理由的情况下失去游戏成果，这和游戏的设计原理是相违背的。

author: {'steamid': '76561198063481516', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 20, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1417305583}
review:
うっかりコレクションを９０％ＯＦＦで買ってしまった・・・

黒い玉を操作して、画面外から来る白い弾を避けながら黒い弾を取るだけのゲーム、
黒い弾を取ると玉のサイズが徐々に大きくなるので、
適度にアクティベートして小さくならないといけないようだ。

はっきり言って９０％ＯＦＦで買っても損した気分になるゲーム、
一昔前の無料で遊べたFlashゲームと同レベルです。

author: {'steamid': '76561197992801270', 'num_games_owned': 3933, 'num_reviews': 188, 'playtime_forever': 48, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 48, 'last_played': 1407524562}
review: This is by far the easiest and shortest of the BIT.TRIP games but it's still pretty fun.  The concept is unique and the style is definitely something that takes a moment to get used to, but overall it's a good time.  For anyone that's a perfectionist or wants more leaderboard style of competition, this one is definitely the way to go over the other games since your aversion to risk couple with dodging skills can wrack up points beyond a "perfect" run in the other games.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997031234', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 86, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 86, 'last_played': 1405545254}
review:
Bit.Trip Void is the third entry in the Bit.Trip series, taking a much different gameplay approach not seen in many games. As with the other Bit.Trip games, it has its pixel based graphics and chiptune style music. However, this game's aesthetic is more chilled out with the backgrounds being mostly solid colors and gradients and the music having a more relaxed beat. The story brings Commander Video with other people who look like him and interacting some kind of aura or ball that makes them bigger or smaller. That brings us to the gameplay, which indeed revolves around a kind of ball.
On the screen is a black circle that can be controlled around. The goal is to get black blocks and avoid white ones. There are different patterns to react to with differing amounts of black and white blocks and some powerups that will be useful to finish some sections. The end bosses tend to reference other Arcade games from the 80s and fit in with the gameplay. In a way, this game feels like Katamari as the goal is to collect objects and in doing so, increases your circle's size. There is a button that allows you to reset your circle to the smallest, which is important to avoid white blocks or move faster. Hitting white blocks can make the ball smaller, but you do lose some points that way.
This game tends to be easier than the last 2 in the series, which is evident by the more relaxed style rather than the more energetic visual style of previous games. Simply controlling a black circle to collect other things and avoiding white lends some precise player control like in platformers or shoot em ups. The rhythm element is still in this game where collecting black squares make a sound, but the player has more control and can somewhat vary how each set of sounds play. Regardless, the unique gameplay makes this fun yet relaxing to play. That isn't to say this game is very easy, since the game does throw some challenging things that may cause a game over.
Bit.Trip Void is overall less energetic to give some relaxed gameplay with a slightly easier difficulty. The idea of collecting black while avoiding white is simple, yet lends itself to some complex patterns to tackle and has some difficult challenges that can appear. With a simple yet original gameplay idea and more mellow design, Void is both fun to play and not as taxing on reaction time while having some moments of difficulty to mix things up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032788858', 'num_games_owned': 1106, 'num_reviews': 678, 'playtime_forever': 209, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 209, 'last_played': 1403999015}
review:
Аркадная черная дыра.

Управлять вам дадут черной точкой (черной дырой). Задача, стоящая перед вами, очень проста - собирать черные точки и пропускать белые. Главное не лажать. По началу все довольно просто и ваша реакция успевает за игрой. Однако рано или поздно вам придется отправиться в черно-белый мир, дабы испытать свои шансы на победу. Проиграете в нем - потерпите полное фиаско. Меня очень порадовали схватки с местными боссами. Они даже лучше, чем в остальных биттрипах. Обязательно стоит остановиться на отличном 8-ми битном саундтреке. Геймплей заточен под него или наоборот). Приятно видить, что даже музыка реагирует на ваши прямые действия. Визуальный стиль узнаваем, именно тот, что и в остальных играх франчайза.

Пожирай в ритм! 7,5 из 10 :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197988663774', 'num_games_owned': 3540, 'num_reviews': 351, 'playtime_forever': 86, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 55, 'last_played': 1403899081}
review:
I like this game because it's the only BIT.TRIP game I've actually been able to beat.

More seriously, the BIT.TRIP saga is all rhythm action games, and VOID was significantly easier than BEAT, CORE, or RUNNER for me. They're all decently put together, though I think RUNNER is the best of the ones I've played. I can't really give any of them except maybe CORE anything other than a thumbs-up, though, because of just how well the music and the graphics work together.

My final recommendation on this? Buy RUNNER, but if you can't beat RUNNER, buy this and actually be capable of beating a BIT.TRIP game. :P

author: {'steamid': '76561198005408313', 'num_games_owned': 764, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 137, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 108, 'last_played': 1404052327}
review: Если [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/205060/]BIT.TRIP CORE[/url] является не иначе как симулятором вычислительного блока системы противоракетной обороны по обработке  множественных целей наведения (как по сложности игрового процесса, так и по лаконичному исполнению), то BIT.TRIP VOID это уже имитатор баллистической ракеты – доберись до цели не ухайдакавшись. Играть стало проще и, за счёт клёвой звуковой обработки событий, интереснее. Визуально игра и сдержанна и выразительна одновременно. Неизменным осталось и мизантропическое, скажем просто – садистское управление на крестовине. Вроде и напрашивается в игре управление мышью, но [strike]художник[/strike] автор [i]так видит[/i], его право, впрочем. Так что кержаковить придётся очень часто.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068287096', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 30, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1418050889}

author: {'steamid': '76561198022997080', 'num_games_owned': 2142, 'num_reviews': 388, 'playtime_forever': 65, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1402961205}
review:
Void is possibly the oddest and hardest to classify of Gaijin Games Bit.Trip saga. Playing as what more or less amounts to an all consuming black hole, black and white blocks come at you from all sides of the screen in time with the beat of the track, and your job is to grab the former and dodge the latter. Every block you manage to catch increases your size a bit, which gives you more points but makes it harder to dodge obstacles and slower to move around, creating a game of give and take as you attempt to keep yourself as large as possible before having to shrink back down.

At its core, I think the ideas behind Void are really original and intriguing despite being incredible simple, but my issue with it is that Gaijin doesn't seem to have any idea what its doing with these mechanics. Through the games 3 levels I never felt particularly impressed with any of the patterns or sequences, they simply played out and I went through the motions to complete them, without so much as a small bit of satisfaction or enjoyment coming from it. Although it's a very short game (I finished it in under an hour), it drags its feet so much during levels that I found myself wishing it would end only halfway through a level. It fumbles over the line of acceptable repetition into monotony, and as a result I can't see myself wanting to ever replay it (which is definitely something the developers were hoping for, given its leaderboard centric design).

It's not that I think Bit.Trip Void is a bad game, it's just an unfocused one that attempts something neat but screws up the execution. The art design and soundtrack are as excellent as the series is known for, but where Gaijin's other games kept me glued to my screen for hours on end, this one made me want to abandon ship after only a handful of minutes with it. For as much as I love the rest of the series, there's no denying that that is a definite problem, and reason enough for me not to be able to recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026546926', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 26, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1364022000}

author: {'steamid': '76561198003057454', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 271, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 101, 'last_played': 1461968324}
review: A mesmerising game, both audially and visually. Highly addictive, simple gameplay premise that's played with in increasingly creative and surprising ways as you delve further in. The interface and general aesthetics are like nothing I've seen before it, scores, multipliers etc simply drift along vaguely in the background, barely noticeable, even mode changes are subtle enough that you might not realise when it happens at first. It's my personal favourite in the BIT.TRIP series, an overall enveloping experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055338667', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 40, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1388147627}
review:
Bullethell. Dodge white pixels, collect black. Black makes you larger, white resets you to normal size. Collect too many white, or dodge too many black; and it's game over.

Maybe the most addicting of the Bit.Trip series.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047611805', 'num_games_owned': 200, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 16, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1387893928}
review:
Un gameplay original (le mot "original" étant trop faible, nous devrions usiter de l'expression WTF), je disais donc un gameplay WTF DAT SHIT, des musiques entraînantes, un jeu facile à prendre en main, difficile à maîtriser, une addiction démarrant très (trop) rapidement. Bref, encore une maître pièce de Gaijin qui me fait plus penser à du BIT.TRIP.BEAT qu'à du BIT.TRIP.RUNNER. Quoi qu'il en soit, c'est encore une fois dans le menu qu'on apprendra à jouer au jeu, et ça, ça n'a pas de prix.
Must Have (il coûte 80 centimes quoi bande de rats)

author: {'steamid': '76561197967992446', 'num_games_owned': 1178, 'num_reviews': 544, 'playtime_forever': 194, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 62, 'last_played': 1402859390}
review: If you've played Bit.Trip Beat, you're pretty much guessing what to expect (brutally difficult exercises in black pixel collection, reaction speed, and pattern recognition). This time, you move a circle around and avoid white beats while collecting black beats! Also there's some subtext about the three elements of the personality (the Id, Ego, and Superego), but nobody will really care about that.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994139784', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 186, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 130, 'last_played': 1402315605}
review:
Freud meets BIT.TRIP! A weird concept this one, although not new. Again, three big levels (ID, EGO, SUPER-EGO) with demanding difficulties. 

Don’t aVOID BIT.TRIP VOID.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032255747', 'num_games_owned': 886, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 56, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1367391600}
review:
一言で言うとチキンレース
黒を取りまくればスコアが狙えるけど、白に当たりやすくなるから時々小さくならないといけないよっていう
パッと見分かりづらいけど、やってみると分かる、そんなゲームでした
個人的には結構好き、でもスコアとか背景と一緒に流れてるから見づらい、うぇうぇ

author: {'steamid': '76561197979084213', 'num_games_owned': 4498, 'num_reviews': 1009, 'playtime_forever': 189, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 148, 'last_played': 1401979287}
review:
Move a black dot over other black dots to increase in size while avoiding the white ones. This is the goal of Bit.Trip Void. 
Amazing ? No. Amusing ? Yes.

[Rating: 62/100]
